message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about hearing and the auditory system. Only living organisms with ears and a functioning auditory system can hear sounds. Boulders, rocks, and stone statues are inanimate objects and do not have the biological structures necessary for hearing. Giraffes, on the other hand, are living organisms that possess ears and an auditory system, making them capable of hearing sounds.

This question requires basic knowledge of hearing and the auditory system. Only living organisms with auditory organs can hear sounds. Boulders, rocks, and stone statues are inanimate objects and do not have auditory organs, so they cannot hear sounds. Giraffes, being living organisms, have auditory organs and are capable of hearing sounds. Therefore, option (B) is the correct answer.

Boulders, rocks, and stone statues are all non-living objects and do not have the biological structures necessary for hearing. Therefore, option (B) is the correct answer.
